intro: Gasteranthopsis, commonly known as the "spiny bladder orchid," is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique, inflated, spiny seed pods that resemble small bladders. The plants typically grow in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climates. They produce small, delicate flowers that are often white or pale in color. Due to their specialized habitat and limited distribution, Gasteranthopsis species are considered rare and of conservation interest.
